content.description: Kendall learned in AP Psychology class about the tend-and-befriend theory, in which some people react to stress by tending to their own needs and/or the needs of others and seeking connection with others. Upon hearing that this theory seems mostly to describe the behavior of women instead of men, Kendall remarked to the class that he knew that would be the case all along.
content.question: Which of the following cognitive biases is Kendall demonstrating?

skill.text: 1.B: Explain how cultural norms, expectations, and circumstances, as well as cognitive biases apply to behavior and mental processes.
